title: Call for Papers The Third Annual Conference on Capital Market Research in the Era of AI
description: Call for Papers The Third Annual Conference on Capital Market Research in the Era of AI Co-Organized by Tsinghua PBCSF, CKGSB, HKUST Business School and SUSTech College of Business In Collaboration with the Asian Bureau of Finance and Economic Research (ABFER), and the Journal of Finance and Data Science (JFDS) 18-19 August 2025 • Beijing China We are excited to organize the Third Annual Conference on Capital Market Research in the Era of AI on 18-19 August, 2025. The conference is co-organized by Tsinghua University PBC School of Finance (Tsinghua PBCSF), Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business (CKGSB), the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) School of Business and Management and the Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech) College of Business in collaboration with the Asian Bureau of Finance and Economic Research (ABFER), and the Journal of Finance and Data Science (JFDS). This two-day event will focus on AI applications in finance and related industries. It will bring together academics, industry experts, and regulators to explore the latest developments, opportunities, and challenges related to investing in the era of AI, particularly in Asia but not limited to just Asia. The conference will take place on Aug 18-19 in Tsinghua University PBC School of Finance in Bejing, China. Anyone interested in learning about the evolving and progressing intersection of AI and investment is welcome to attend. The conference will provide hotel accommodations for accepted paper presenters, paper discussants, and session moderators for up to 3 nights. This conference will provide a unique opportunity for attendees to network with like-minded academics and professionals and gain valuable knowledge and insights to help make informed investment decisions. The conference will feature a keynote speech, interactive workshops, and panel discussions on a range of topics related to AI and investment. We invite the submission of research papers in all areas related to the intersection of AI and investment, including but not limited to the following topics. We particularly encourage the submission of Asia-related research papers. •	The applications of AI, machine learning, natural language processing, and other novel analytic methods in research for all areas of financial economics. •	The use of unstructured data (e.g., text, images, voice and facial recognition, mobile footprint, satellite data, geolocation, and social media) in investment and related areas such as auditing and assurance. •	The use of machine learning/AI/high-performance computing in the finance industry and academic research. •	The social and economic impact of AI adoption, i.e., the opportunities and challenges associated with the widespread adoption of AI and its impact on stakeholders of adopting firms and industries. •	The ethical considerations of AI in finance, including issues related to bias and transparency. •	Quantitative investment strategies and portfolio optimization with machine learning technologies or other AI models. In addition to the paper presentation and discussion, there will be an industry and policy panel on AI in Capital Market Research at the conference. The Asian Bureau of Finance and Economic Research (https://abfer.org/) will include the accepted program papers in its working paper series. The panel discussion at the conference, as well as a newsletter about the conference, will be published in the 2025 issue of JFDS. Furthermore, the JFDS will sponsor one Best Paper Award and one Best Discussant Award, $1000 each award. PAPER SUBMISSION PROCEDURE The deadline for manuscript submission is May 15, 2025. Please submit an electronic copy, including a one-page abstract (MS Word or PDF only) to aicm@pbcsf.tsinghua.edu.cn. Decisions of acceptance will be announced by Jun 15, 2025. On-site participation is by invitation only, online attending will be arranged through XUESHUO Platform. Conference Program Committee •	Henry Cao, Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business (CKGSB) •	Wilbur Chen, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) •	Jingzhi Huang, Penn State University (PennState) and Journal of Finance and Data Science (JFDS) •	Mingyi Hung, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) •	Bernard Yeung, Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech), National University of Singapore (NUS), Asian Bureau of Finance and Economic Research (ABFER) •	Haifeng You, Tsinghua University (THU) •	Amy Zang, The Hong Kong University of Science and Technology (HKUST) •	Hao Zhou, Southern University of Science and Technology (SUSTech) and Tsinghua University (THU) Call For Papers on SSRN: https://www.ssrn.com/index.cfm/en/janda/announcement/?id=16457 For reference to past conferences, please click the following, 2nd Year Conference Programs: https://business.sustech.edu.cn/web/aicm/index.php https://business.sustech.edu.cn/web/aicm/program_rundown.php 1st Year Conference Programs: https://cn.ckgsb.com/JFDS/2023/ConferenceProgram.aspx https://acct.hkust.edu.hk/2023-research-conference-program-rundown Panel Discussion and Newsletter for the 1st Year Conference Published in the JFDS: https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S2405918824000011 2nd Year Conference Participating Lists: https://business.sustech.edu.cn/web/aicm/participation_list.php 1st Year Conference Participating Lists: https://cn.ckgsb.com/JFDS/2023/Participants.aspx

title: Call for Papers: 10th SDU Finance Workshop on Corporate Finance – Dynamics, Uncertainty, and Strategic Decisions
location: University of Southern Denmark (SDU), Odense, Denmark
description: KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Philip Valta from the University of Bern will give a talk on “Strategic Dynamics in Corporate Finance: Decisions, Interactions, and Outcomes”. ORGANIZING COMMITTEE: Christian Riis Flor, Alexander Schandlbauer, Charlotte Sun Clausen-Jørgensen, Julian Hölzermann, Hyun Joong Kim, Mo Zhang, and Rikke Sejer Nielsen. CONFERENCE WEBPAGE: https://www.sdu.dk/en/sdufinanceworkshop OVERVIEW: The finance group at the Department of Business and Management of the University of Southern Denmark is pleased to announce the 10th SDU finance workshop. We invite submissions in all areas of finance related to the theme Corporate Finance -- Dynamics, Uncertainty, and Strategic Decisions. This will be a one-day workshop with a small number of papers on the program in order to allow for ample time for discussions and to create a stimulating environment. Each paper will be reviewed for conference admission and have a discussant. The workshop will be held in person (not online). Participants are expected to cover their own travel and accommodation expenses; however, we may be able to partly cover the accommodation in Odense. Refreshments during the workshop, including a conference dinner, are offered to presenters, discussants, and selected participants. PAPER SUBMISSION PROCEDURE: Submission is open from January 31. Please submit the full paper or an extended abstract by March 17, 2025. The submission fee is 300 DKK (approx. 40 EUR) per paper (VAT included). There is no participation fee. To submit a paper and pay the submission fee, please go to https://www.tilmeld.dk/10thsdufinworkshop Author notification will be provided in mid-April. For more information, please contact Christian Riis Flor by email, crf@sam.sdu.dk PAST PROGRAMS: Information about past programs is available at https://www.sdu.dk/en/forskning/forskningsenheder/samf/finance/events-and-seminar/sdufinanceworkshop/previousworkshops

title: 2nd Alpine Finance Summit 2025
description: The Alpine Finance Summit (AFS) brings together leading finance scholars for a unique blend of cutting-edge academic exchange and outdoor activities in the heart of the French Alps. Following the 2025 European Finance Association (EFA) Annual Meeting in Paris, this exclusive conference provides a platform for high-caliber presentations and (invited) discussions. RESEARCH AREAS We welcome submissions in the following areas: Asset Pricing | Investments | Sustainable Finance | Innovative Finance (e.g., Blockchain, Machine Learning) | FinTech Papers should be unpublished and will undergo a double-blind review process. KEYNOTE SPEAKER Prof. Amit Goyal, Ph.D. (University of Lausanne & Swiss Finance Institute) CONFERENCE HIGHLIGHTS Venue: Park Hôtel Grenoble – MGallery (4-star, special rates available) and the CHAMROUSSE mountain resort. Website: www.alpinefinancesummit.org Contact: alpinefinancesummit@gmail.com Local Organizer: University of Liechtenstein We look forward to welcoming you to Grenoble for an unforgettable combination of academic excellence and Alpine adventure!

title: 32nd FINANCE FORUM
description: You are invited to submit papers to be considered for presentation at the 32nd Finance Forum, the Annual Meeting of the Spanish Finance Association (AEFIN), to be held July 2-4, 2025, at the Public University of Navarre, Pamplona, Spain. We are planning to host the conference entirely in person. The SUBMISSION DEADLINE is February 16, 2025, at 11:59 PM CET. The Finance Forum will take place at the Public University of Navarre (Campus Arrosadía situated in Pamplona) on July 3-4, 2025. We are honored to announce Professor Turan G. Bali (Georgetown University) and Professor Philipp Schnabl (New York University) as the keynote speakers. The Finance Forum will also feature a PhD Mentoring Day on July 2nd (the day before the conference), where PhD students will present their research and receive feedback from top specialists in their fields. Moreover, students will benefit from the valuable advice from the invited professors Diana Bonfim (Banco de Portugal and Católica Lisbon School of Business and Economics) and Fernando Zapatero (Questrom School of Business at Boston University). AEFIN will provide 16 scholarships for the best papers of the PhD Mentoring Day covering the registration fee to the Finance Forum plus the accommodation. The Finance Forum and the PhD Mentoring Day invite submissions in all areas of Financial Economics research, such as (but not limited to): Asset Pricing, Corporate Finance, Banking, Portfolio Choice and Asset Management, Microstructure, Regulation, Financial Stability and Macrofinance. PhD students can submit to both the Finance Forum and the PhD Mentoring Day. IMPORTANT DATES •	Paper Submission Deadline: February 16, 2025 •	Paper Acceptance Decision: March 30, 2025 •	Early Registration: April 1 – April 30, 2025 •	Late Registration: May 1 – June 30, 2025 •	PhD Mentoring Day: July 2, 2025 •	Finance Forum: July 3 – 4, 2025 SUBMISSION AND CONFERENCE WEBSITE Submission will be done through Conference Maker-32nd Finance Forum. There is a single 50 € fee per paper submitted to the Finance Forum. No papers will be processed without the payment. Submitting more than one paper implies payment for each paper. Submissions to the PhD Mentoring Day and single author papers submitted by PhD students to the 32nd Finance Forum are exempt from submission fees. To apply this exemption it is necessary to send a PhD certificate to 32financeforum@unavarra.es. For submission policies and guidelines, see https://finance-forum.es/call-for-papers/ AWARDS The following awards will be granted at the Conference: •	AEFIN Award to the Best paper of the Finance Forum •	BME Award to the best paper on Stock Markets •	BME Award to the best paper on Fixed Income •	BME Award to the best paper on Derivatives •	CNMV Award to the best paper on Regulation •	INVERCO Award to the best paper on Asset Management •	SANFI Award to the Best paper on Banking PROGRAM CHAIR Ana Gonzalez-Urteaga (Public University of Navarre) Pamplona Before San Fermín: A Unique Experience As the days leading up to San Fermín (July 6th) approach, the city of Pamplona already begins to transform with an incredible atmosphere. The streets come alive with excitement, and the festive spirit is palpable throughout the city. This is a wonderful time to experience Pamplona, as the city is buzzing with energy even before the official celebrations begin. Save the Dates and Book Your Stay Early! We encourage you to mark your calendars and book your accommodations for the conference as soon as possible. To ensure availability, make your hotel reservations before the dates specified by each of the concerted accommodations. If you plan to stay for San Fermín, we recommend booking your stay well in advance, as rooms fill up quickly during this world-famous festival.

title: CALL FOR PAPERS – 2nd Knut Wicksell Conference on Crypto and Fintech
description: The Knut Wicksell Centre for Financial Studies at Lund University, Sweden invites submissions to the Knut Wicksell Conference on Crypto and Fintech. Date: Thursday-Friday, 28-29 August 2025, in Lund, Sweden. Keynote lecture by: Professor Marco Di Maggio, Imperial College London The Knut Wicksell Conference on Crypto and Fintech is a boutique-style conference welcoming submissions on topics including but not limited to: · Crypto and blockchain technology (asset pricing, systemic risk, market microstructure) · Crypto markets, households, and the real economy · Environmental and social impact of crypto markets · Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) · Financial technology (Fintech) · Payment systems (payment firms, consumer experiences, bank competition) · Interaction between traditional finance and decentralized finance Last year’s program is available at https://www.lusem.lu.se/calendar/knut-wicksell-conference-crypto-and-fintech Paper submission: Submit complete papers by May 1, 2025 to LundConference2024@nek.lu.se Notification of acceptance: Authors will be notified of acceptance by June 1, 2025. Authors of accepted papers should be prepared to act as discussants during the conference. Also, people with an interest in the topic are welcome to participate without presenting papers. The number of participants is limited and slots for non-presenters are allocated on a first come first served basis. There is no participation fee. There will be a conference dinner on Thursday 28th of August. Lund is a small historic university town in southern Sweden about 35 minutes by train from Copenhagen airport. Please do not hesitate to contact us at LundConference2024@nek.lu.se if you have any questions. On behalf of the organizers, Andreas Johansson, Talina Sondershaus and Anders Vilhelmsson Department of Economics Lund University

title: International Conference on Payments and Settlement Systems
description: The Bank of Canada, in partnership with Deutsche Bundesbank, will host the 3rd edition of the International Conference on Payments and Securities Settlement on June 12 and 13, 2025 at its head office in Ottawa. About the conference: This conference aims to bring together academic and central bank researchers, policymakers and practitioners to discuss the latest economic research focused on the developments, challenges and opportunities in payments and securities settlement. Call for papers: Topics of interest for the conference include: - Issues and trends in cross-border payments - Tools for detecting and mitigating fraud and cyber risks in payment systems - Risk analysis and participant behaviour in financial market infrastructures - Opportunities and challenges due to alternative payment instruments and systems - Innovations in settlement systems and the evolving role of financial intermediaries - Payments data insights, privacy preservation and fostering competition - Insights from using new empirical methods on payments and settlement data - Safety and efficiency of real-time gross settlement systems - Limited travel support is available for academic speakers at the conference. Submission process: Interested authors are invited to E-mail their papers to ICPSS_2025@bank-banque-canada.ca. Extended abstracts will also be considered. Deadlines: Deadline for paper submission is March 9, 2025. Authors of accepted papers will be notified by April 15, 2025. Scientific committee: Ajit Desai (Bank for International Settlements) Martin Diehl (Deutsche Bundesbank) Matti Hellqvist (Bank of Finland) Matthias Jüttner (Swiss National Bank) Ye Li (University of Washington) Maarten van Oordt (Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam) Jan Paulick (Bank for International Settlements) Francisco Rivadeneyra (Bank of Canada) Katrin Tinn (McGill University) Russell Wong (Federal Reserve Bank of Richmond)

title: Call for Papers: 21st Annual Conference of the Asia-Pacific Association of Derivatives (APAD)
description: The Asia-Pacific Association of Derivatives (APAD) will hold its 21st Annual Conference both offline and online on July 14th and 15th, 2025 at the Park Hyatt Busan in Busan, Korea. Free accommodations for paper presenters will be provided under the auspices of the Korea Derivatives Association and the Korea Exchange. We welcome papers on any fields of study in finance including: Derivatives; Volatility; Risk Management; Asset Pricing; Investments; Corporate Finance; Corporate Governance; Market Microstructure; Banking; Personal and Household Finance; ESG and Climate Finance; AI and Big Data; Blockchain and Crypto Assets; Fintech; Regulation; Behavioral Finance among others. IMPORTANT DATES •	Full Paper Submission Deadline: April 30th, 2025 (http://www.conftool.net/apad2025) •	Notification of Acceptance: May 22nd, 2025 •	Final Registration Date: June 4th, 2025 (http://www.conftool.net/apad2025) •	Final Paper Submission Date: June 18th, 2025 (http://www.conftool.net/apad2025) LOCATION •	Online and In-Person, Busan, Korea GUIDELINES •	Papers written in English must be submitted via http://www.conftool.net/apad2025, using MS Word or Adobe pdf file format. •	All papers must be accompanied by an abstract of around 200 words. •	The cover page of all manuscripts should include the paper’s title as well as name, affiliation, address, phone number, and email address of every author. The second page should contain the paper’s title and abstract only. •	If you have any question with the paper submission, please let us know via email at apad@kdajdqs.org. •	We hope that each participant agrees to serve as the discussant for another participant’s paper when asked. •	Best Paper Awards: Selected papers will be awarded at the conference for US$1,000 each. KEYNOTE SPEECH •	TBA ACCOMMODATIONS •	Free accommodation of one night at the conference hotel including the gala dinner will be provided for paper presenters who participate on-site. •	Hotel: Park Hyatt Busan, Busan, Korea, https://www.hyatt.com/en-US/hotel/south-korea/park-hyatt-busan/busph REGISTRATION •	Registration fee is US$ 200, which is waived for presenters of accepted papers. ABOUT THE APAD The APAD, with the inaugural conference held in 2004, is an organization aiming to bring together academics, practitioners, and regulators operating in the derivatives markets in the Asia-Pacific region. The main objective of the association is to promote research and knowledge on derivative securities and markets. The APAD has been supported by the Korea Exchange (KRX) and other participating exchanges in the Asia-Pacific region. ABOUT THE CONFERENCE CITY •	Busan is Korea's second largest city and the largest trading port. This harbor city sits adjacent to the Korean Straits and Japan and is a major hub for trade and tourism. Busan has hosted international events such as the 2002 14th Asian Games and the annual Busan International Film Festival (BIFF). •	Sight-seeing in Busan (or Pusan) can typically be classified into two groups: seashore and interior land sight-seeing. Seashore sightseeing includes such sights as the beach areas, islands, and many seashore parks. Busan's most charming tourist point is its beautiful sea vistas. The southeastern beach areas have amazing views of the fantastically shaped rocks and islands, which are a must see. The famous beaches of Haeundae, Gwangalli, and Songjeong are enjoyed by many. Boating, jet skis, and banana boats are just among a few of the water recreation activities visitors can take advantage of. Amnam Park and Iigidae costal park offer views of nature's masterpieces. The natural beauties of Busan can also be taken in by riding the cruise boats departing from the harbor. title: 6th CANADIAN SUSTAINABLE FINANCE NETWORK CONFERENCE
location: Schulich School of Business, York University Toronto, Canada
description: The Schulich School of Business and the Centre of Excellence in Responsible Business at York University are pleased to be hosting the 6th Canadian Sustainable Finance Network Conference on June 5-6, 2025. CSFN The Canadian Sustainable Finance Network (CSFN) is an independent formal research and educational network for academia, industry and government to bring together a network of university faculty members and relevant members from industry, government and civil society. CFSN is essential to sharing learnings and open the door to future research topics as well as creating partnerships with other entities from across Canada and globally. 6th Canadian Sustainable Finance Network Conference The CSFN conference invites submissions of original research papers on sustainable finance for presentation at the 2025 conference to be held on June 5-6, 2025 at Schulich School of Business, York University in Toronto. The conference brings together academics and financial industry participants with a shared commitment to sustainable finance, offering a forum for exploring the latest research and educational innovations in the field. The conference provides an opportunity to discuss pressing issues in sustainable finance development both within Canada and on a global scale. Ultimately, the conference aims to serve as a platform that fosters discussions to advance sustainable finance research and education across Canada. Plenary Speaker We are pleased to announce that our plenary speaker will be Prof. Dr. Zacharias Sautner, Professor of Sustainable Finance at the Department of Finance of the University of Zurich (UZH) and Senior Chair at the Swiss Finance Institute (SFI). Dates to Remember March 15, 2025: Submission deadline for full papers March 31, 2025: Notification of acceptance April 30, 2025: Registration deadline. Details to come. Submission and Conference Website Please submit full paper submission as a Word or PDF attachment to CSFN2025@schulich.yorku.ca For submission policies and guidelines, see https://csfn2025.schulich.yorku.ca/submissions/
